answers.answer: Hi there,Mild elevations in alanine transaminase and aspartate transaminase can be due to benign and serious causes both. The common causes of liver transaminase elevations are viral hepatitis, alcohol intake, medication use, steatosis or steatohepatitis, and cirrhosis. Other common health conditions like diabetes, heart disease, and thyroid disease, can cause or augment liver transaminase elevations.Non alcoholic fatty liver is the commonest cause of asymptomatic rise in liver transaminases.Reduce weight if you are overweight.Lifestlye changes like diet modifications and exercise may be helpful. Do consult a doctor and get your doubts clarified. Keep us posted on how you are doing.Take care and kind regards!

question: 25 year old male, 6 feet 1 inch tall, weighs 225, moderately active, just got back AST level of 123 and ALT level of 62, negative Hep screening and no alcohol intake in past 4 years, any idea?
title: Elevated ALT and AST Levels
